snippet: A series of measures — including an effort to impose criminal penalties on executives who fail to disclose deadly automobile defects — failed to proceed on Capitol Hill.
abstract: Legislation that would establish stricter regulation and penalties on automobile industry regarding safety defects have largely gone nowhere, despite record year of automobile recalls; automaker lobbyists have tapped Republican allies to successfully kill transportation bill provisions proposed by Senate Democrats on commerce committee commerce.
lead_paragraph: A series of measures — including an effort to impose criminal penalties on executives who fail to disclose deadly automobile defects — failed to proceed on Capitol Hill.

headline.main: Senate Committee’s No Vote Incenses Lawmakers Seeking Auto Safety Reforms
headline.print_headline: Senate Committee’s No Vote Incenses Lawmakers Seeking Auto Safety Reforms
